Sentencas: Power generation using gas turbine (GT) power plants operating on the Brayton cycle suffers from low efficiencies, resulting in poor fuel to power conversion.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is proposed for integration into a 10 MW gas turbine power plant, operating at 30% efficiency, in order to improve system efficiencies and economics.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: The SOFC system is indirectly coupled to the gas turbine power plant, paying careful attention to minimize the disruption to the GT operation.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: A thermo-economic model is developed for the hybrid power plant, and predicts an optimized power output of 20.6 MW at 49.9% efficiency.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: The model also predicts a break-even per-unit energy cost of USD 4.65 c kWh(-1) for the hybrid system based on futuristic mass generation SOFC costs.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant

Sentencas: This shows that SOFCs may be indirectly integrated into existing GT power systems to improve their thermodynamic and economic performance.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling of an indirectly coupled solid oxide fuel cell/gas turbine hybrid power plant
